questions.text: Newborn is being resuscitated. Term child has heart rate of 50 beats per minute after 30 seconds of ventilation through an endotracheal tube and on additional 60 seconds of co-ordinated chest compression and ventilation using 100% oxygen. Next step in management is:

options.label: A
options.text: Intravenous epinephrine through a peripheral intravenous catheter in the baby’s right hand

options.label: B
options.text: Intravenous epinephrine through a peripheral intravenous catheter in the baby’s left hand

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous epinephrine through an umblical venous catheter

options.label: D
options.text: Intravenous epinephrine through the lower leg

questions.correct_answer: C. Intravenous epinephrine through an umblical venous catheter

questions.text: Mother received opiate medication for pain relief 1 hour before delivery. After birth, the baby does not have spontaneous respirations and does not improve with stimulation. Most appropriate next step is:

2.5 kg baby girl was born to a primigravida, O positive at 37 weeks of gestation. At 72 hours child is active, total serum bilirubin is 14mg/dL, and blood group is A positive. The delivery was uneventful. Following finding you expect in this child:

options.label: A
options.text: Direct Coomb’s test negative & presence of microspherocytes on peripheral blood

options.label: B
options.text: Direct Coomb’s test positive & presence of microspherocytes on peripheral blood

options.label: C
options.text: Direct Coomb’s test positive and no microspherocytes on peripheral blood

options.label: D
options.text: Bilirubin becomes normal on giving phenobarbitone

questions.correct_answer: B. Direct Coomb’s test positive & presence of microspherocytes on peripheral blood

questions.text: Full term newborn weighing 3.2 kg at birth was born by vaccum delivery. He presented with irritability on day 4 of life. There is no history of fever, abnormal movements or feeding difficulties. On examination there is pallor, icterus till abdomen and no hepatosplenomegaly. There is nontender, fluctuant large swelling over occipital area extending to temporal and parietal area on both the sides over scalp. Most probable diagnosis is:
Neonate presented with abnormal movement of right arm and legs. Apgar score was 7 and 9. Serum glucose level and calcium is normal. Out of the following helpful in diagnosis is:

options.label: A
options.text: Mother with seizure disorder taking phenobarbitone during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: History of delayed cry at birth

questions.text: Child birth weight 4 kg now has blood glucose level 30mg/dL at 24 hours of age. APGAR score was 8 and 10. On examination jitterness is present. There is no murmur and normal male genitalia. Most appropriate initial test is:

3.5 kg female newborn was delivered by an elective cesarean section. At 10 minutes of age, respiratory rate is 65/min, mild chest indrawing, HR 145/min, saturation is 94%. Radiological findings present on chest X-ray will most likely be
Out of the following which can remain open after 6 months without any clinical significance is:

24 hrs old child appears blue around the mouth. On examination his tongue looks blue and there is peripheral cyanosis. His respiratory rate is 60/min. On auscultation of the chest there is no murmur. Pulses are all four limbs can be palpated and are equal in volume. Most likely diagnosis is:
questions.correct_answer: B. Transposition of the great arteries

questions.text: 7 year old child is having feature of rickets. On biochemical investigation the serum PTH is normal, serum phosphorus is normal and serum calcium is decreased. Child was given cholecalciferol twice and same findings are present. Most likely cause is:
Pseudo dominant inheritance is seen in the following:

options.label: A
options.text: An X-linked disorder appears as autosomal dominant

options.label: B
options.text: An autosomal dominant appears as recessive trait

options.label: C
options.text: An autosomal recessive disorder appears as autosomal dominant

options.label: D
options.text: An autosomal dominant appears as X-linked disorder

questions.correct_answer: C. An autosomal recessive disorder appears as autosomal dominant

questions.text: 2 - year - old boy has spasticity in both lower limbs. Deep tendon reflexes are increased. MRI of his brain is most likely to show:
4 year old boy with history of fever for 2 days comes with history of convulsion lasting for 10 minutes. He is now alert and responding well. Out of the following to be done is:

options.label: A
options.text: EEG and MRI brain is indicated

options.label: B
options.text: Only sleep EEG should be done

options.label: C
options.text: Seizure duration of 10 minute requires further investigation

questions.text: In a child diagnosed as panhypopituarism following finding can be seen in neonate except:

32 weeks pregnant female is diagnosed with nephrotic syndorme. Her diet is salt restricted and high protein. She is treated with steroids. For last week, generalised swelling has decreased but neck swelling is persisting. Fetus is at high risk for:
14 year old girl with history of precocious puberty and has skin hyperpigmentation since birth. There is no visual defect .Most likely diagnosis is

10 days old neonate, delivered at home is admitted with complaints of persistent jaundice, desquamating skin lesions of hands and feet with mucocutaneous rash. Child cries a lot on handling but is quiet when in the bed. Which of the following is expected to be seen in this child on examination:

8 year old boy has history of headache with blurred vision for last 6 months. On examination height is below 3%. On ophthalmological examination there is bilateral optic nerve atrophy. Out of the following most likely diagnosis is:
Child is able to make a “gate” of 5 cubes, and identifies longer of 2 lines. Most appropriate developmental age is around

Term female infant is brought on day 12 of life weighing 3.8kgs. There is history of frequent regurgitation of feeds and abdominal fullness. Mother feeds the infant every 2 hours. Birth weight was 3kgs. No significant antenatal history. Most probable diagnosis is:
